title: Translating the Statement
text: The statement tell us that if $$x$$ is closer than delta to $$3$$ and $$x$$ is not equal to $$3$$, then f(x) is closer to than $$2$$ than $$-1$$.

title: Visualizing
text: In essence, we are asked to find how close to $$3$$ must $$x$$ be, if $$y$$ is within $$2$$ of $$-1$$ on the graph. We can find this by drawing boundary lines on the graph that fulfill these conditions and making delta the distance from $$x=3$$ to the closer of the $$2$$ $$x-boundary$$ lines.
